clinical_study.brief_title: Erector Spinae Regional Anesthesia for Pain Control
clinical_study.official_title: Erector Spinae Regional Anesthesia for Pain Control in the Emergency Department

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center at San Antonio

brief_summary.textblock: Interventional study to use erector spinae plane block (ESPB) on diagnoses of posterior or lateral rib fractures, vertebral fractures, pancreatitis, pancreatic cancer, renal colic, and back pain for multimodal pain therapy to determine its assistance with pain relief as well as the patient's use of opiates after block completion

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with the listed diagnoses will be offered and then consented for an ESPB under ultrasound guidance. They will rate their pain before and 30 minutes after the procedure using the ordinal categorical data on a numeric pain scale. Total patient opiate use will be gathered up to 8 hours after block completion.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study procedure end (approximately 30 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: Change in pain scale rating assessed by the participants on a scale from 0-10 with 0 indicating no pain and 10 indicating the most severe pain.

arm_group.description: Patients with the listed diagnoses will be offered and then consented for an ESPB under ultrasound guidance.

intervention.description: Bucivacaine will be administered intramuscularly according to package insert directions after first numbing the area with lidocaine subcutaneously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Posterior/lateral rib or vertebral fractures
- Pancreatitis or pancreatic cancer
- Renal colic
- Back pain
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable vitals
- Infection or open wound over insertion site
- Prior allergic reaction to local anesthetic
- Pregnant females
- Patients <18 years old
- Altered mentation

overall_official.affiliation: University of Texas Health Science Center San Antonio

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified data will be shared in a peer reviewed publication after acceptance by the journal
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: At study completion, after acceptance into a peer reviewed journal
